snippet: The new penalties, targeting a series of banks and energy and defense firms, go much further than the limits imposed so far in retaliation for Moscow’s intervention in Ukraine.
abstract: Pres Obama imposes new round of sanctions against Russia in retaliation for Moscow's intervention in Ukraine, targeting some of its most important financial, energy and defense firms; European Union refuses to match American measures and instead adopts more tempered plan that blocks new development loans to Russia and threatens to target more Russian individuals.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The new penalties, targeting a series of banks and energy and defense firms, go much further than the limits imposed so far in retaliation for Moscow’s intervention in Ukraine.

headline.main: Raising Stakes on Russia, U.S. Adds Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Raising Stakes on Russia, U.S. Adds Sanctions
